topics.body:
...
My computer crashed like 3 three times today.
My brother diagnosed [spoiler](I'm quite computer illiterate myself)[/spoiler] it to by a problem with the RAM, as it keeps crashing whenever I do something memory intensive, such as streaming videos on YT.
Not going to be posting much until I have this problem fixed.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a3731563687221de440d00#post_54a3731563687221de440d00
If it's a problem with the ram then take them all out and then test them one by one.  There's a way to test if a ram stick is faulty, but I haven't done this in a while.  If I remember correctly you do a memory check of each ram stick and if one of the sticks shows that it's mb is less than what it says on the stick then it's the stick that is broken.

The crash happens randomly. But most frequent when I'm streaming videos, I don't game anymore. But, my brother also suspects it's the hardrive acting up. I might have to back things up if that's the case. The computer is fine. But damn, RAM is EXPENSIVE lately.

topics.body:
I know it's a continuation of the discussion yesterday about Japanese culture, but I read something interesting.  Well to preface it for one Japanese culture massively looks down upon otakus and geek culture and there's a massive cultural generational gap going on.  What's interesting is that a study of 5k college students in Japan 40% of them classify themselves as otakus.

Basically geeks are taking over Japan, but Japanese culture doesn't like that very much cause Japanese culture shuns geeks.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a38b3063687202ff390600#post_54a38b3063687202ff390600
Isn't Japanese culture also extremely conservative? I wouldn't be surprise if there is a pretty big backlash from the older generation as a result of geek culture's rise over there.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a38b3063687202ff390600#post_54a38b3063687202ff390600
To an extent. So does Chinese culture due to years of Japanophobia.
But a tremendous amount of the young ones are anime and video game fans, particularly from Hong Kong.

Many Taiwanese openly embrace Japanese, and otaku culture.

Koreans on the otherhand... I hear they're traditionally quite Japanophobic. But, they produce many great anime and anime-style works(Manga, games, shows etc) and pride themselves with them.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a38bf06368725aadbd2400#post_54a38bf06368725aadbd2400
You just summarized like 50% of the cultural news from Japan in a single sentence.

People under 30 are massively liberal whereas people over 30 are conservative.  For example 70% of people under thirty in Japan support same-sex marriage where as 70% of those over 60 years old are opposed.  Japan is slowly becoming socially liberal, but they're not going down without a fight first.

Personally I think same-sex marriage will be legalized there in 5-10 years, but I'm just illustrating a point.

The older generations are massively socially conservative whereas the younger ones are becoming ever increasingly socially liberal.  Eventually in a decade or so Japan is going to become socially liberal; it's just their older generations fucked up their economy, fucked up the country, fucked up their future and are now blaming otakus and such for their fuck ups rather than admit they ran their country into the ground.

Japan's mass media won't ever admit it but they also have a massive race problem.

Tl:dr of my point; the older generations in Japan are xenophobic homophobic racists who ran their country into the ground both socially and economically and now that they're losing control of their society rather than admit they fucked up the country they're blaming the younger generations.

Side note: before someone goes "nuh-uh" about the race thing it's mainly the older generations and such and considering history can you really expect those generations that grew up in a extremist nationalist culture to just dump it all of a sudden?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: I find it strange that Japan apparently isn't Geeky. (With Kamen rider Being Popular enough to get a statue of the original and Ultraseven being regarded as an All-time classic over there.)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a38dcc63687219bf260100#post_54a38dcc63687219bf260100
I just hope the young generation at least preserve their heritage. Japanese culture is something that should not be wasted, just remove the archaic parts of it that is keeping Japan back.

I don't want to see another Chinese style Cultural Revolution. Despite leaning slightly left of the spectrum, I'm quite conservative on some aspects. I do support things like Gay marriage though.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc
